revised_title: Observation and Analysis of the Winter Solstice of 1812 at Greenwich
tldr: The author, John Pond, observed the winter solstice of 1812 at the Greenwich Mural Circle and obtained nine observations of the sun despite unfavorable weather conditions. He compared the results with the summer solstice observations and found a small discordance. The author recommends using circumpolar stars to deduce refractions and suggests examining the solstices with these refractions to improve accuracy.
